title: French elections: RN's disreputable candidates expose flaws in party's boasted readiness
summary: The far-right party claimed to be fully prepared for potential early elections, with a plan to conquer the prime minister's office. But dozens of candidates turned out to have racist, homophobic, anti-Semitic or xenophobic leanings.

title: French elections: The last seat estimates before Sunday's second round
summary: With two days to go before the second round of France's parliamentary elections, the far-right Rassemblement National and its allies appear to be in the lead, but short of an absolute majority, according to the latest Ipsos Talan poll for Le Monde, Radio France and France Télévisions.

title: French elections: How is the far right gaining votes from women?
summary: Election after election, the Rassemblement National is convincing more women, who had long been resistant to it. Defenders of women's rights are afraid that feminist achievements will be rolled back by the far-right party if it wins.

title: French elections: Why the dichotomy between the so-called rural and urban vote is misleading
summary: Voting differences between urban and rural areas are first and foremost an effect of their social make-up, not a spatial distinction, according to several specialists, who warn that this idea plays into the far right's hands.

title: French elections: 'Everywhere, always, the far right has ended up adding to the world's woes'
summary: Following the president's irresponsible decision to dissolve the Assemblée Nationale, it's now up to voters to prevent the Rassemblement National from coming to power in France, writes Le Monde's director, Jérôme Fenoglio, in his editorial.

title: French elections: Foreign investors are increasingly nervous
summary: Political uncertainty is fueling apprehension in business circles. Financing the decarbonization of industry could be called into question.

title: France beats Portugal 5-3 in a penalty shootout in Euro 2024 quarterfinals to knock out Ronaldo
summary: After the tied game finished 0-0, Portugal substitute João Félix hit a post with the only miss in the shootout and Théo Hernandez converted the clinching kick. France will now play Spain in the semifinals after its extra-time win over Germany in Stuttgart.

title: Biden rejects independent medical evaluation in ABC interview as he fights to stay in race
summary: The president insisted to ABC's George Stephanopoulos that he is the 'most qualified' to lead Democrats against presumptive Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump.

title: UK left's victory comes with responsibilities
summary: The historic majority obtained by Keir Starmer's Labour in Parliament must now be transformed into perceptible progress for the working classes, who have largely returned to Labour but are also being courted by the far right.

title: UK general election: Starmer vows 'government of service' in first speech as British PM
summary: Keir Starmer officially became prime minister of the United Kingdom on Friday after Labour trounced the Conservative party in Thursday's general election.

title: 'It's like living in an oven': Pakistan and India crushed by deadly heat waves
summary: Since May, a series of heat waves have swept across the northern part of the Indian subcontinent causing hundreds of deaths, particularly in large cities. The region's impoverished inhabitants are the first to suffer.

title: Hungary's Orban holds Ukraine talks with Putin on trip slammed by EU
summary: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban met with his Russian counterpart in Moscow on Friday after a recent visit to Kyiv in which he told Volodymyr Zelensky to consider a 'ceasefire.'

title: UK general election: Labour's historic victory over the Conservatives reshapes political landscape
summary: Labour won over 400 seats in the House of Commons, ending 14 years of Conservative government. Labour leader Keir Starmer is set to succeed Rishi Sunak at 10 Downing Street. In a surprise move, Nigel Farage's far-right Reform UK party entered Westminster.

title: In Argentina, the disappearance of a child fuels mistrust of the system
summary: Loan Danilo Peña, 5, disappeared in June in the north of the country. The delays and fumbling in the investigation are fueling public criticism of the local police and justice authorities.

title: At Rencontres d'Arles, photography puts on its military fatigues
summary: Matthieu Nicol, a collector of photographs, found images from a US military center advertising military uniforms. The series is on display at the Rencontres d'Arles photography festival.

title: US left-wing media lift silence on President Biden's health
summary: Until the failed June 27 debate with Donald Trump, the age of the American president, 81, and his cognitive state had hardly attracted any comment from most of the media.

title: New UK Foreign Secretary David Lammy backs 'immediate ceasefire' in Gaza
summary: 'All of us recognize the agony of communities who have seen the scenes coming out of Israel and Gaza,' the recently-appointed David Lammy said from the Foreign Office. 'But the job now is to get to work with tireless diplomacy to support an immediate ceasefire.'

title: Kremlin critic Kara-Murza transferred to prison hospital
summary: Vladimir Kara-Murza vocally campaigned against Putin for years. Fears for his well-being have increased since Alexei Navalny died in an Arctic prison colony in February.

title: Tour de France: Pogacar stays in yellow as Evenepoel wins time trial
summary: Remco Evenepoel beat Tadej Pogacar by 12 seconds, but remains 33 seconds behind in the general classification.

title: Israel grabs largest tract of West Bank land in three decades
summary: Over 1,200 hectares of Palestinian land have been declared 'state land' by Benjamin Netanyahu's government. This decision, taken in the context of the war in Gaza, is part of a policy of annexing territory of the West Bank.

title: French elections: 'I'm not disappointed by Macron. It's a dog's job to be at the Elysée'
summary: Le Monde spoke with people from across France about their personal hopes and fears in the run-up to the second round of snap elections that could see the far right reach power. Today, Laurent Dunoyer, 71, retired from the communications business.

title: In Ukraine, the Russian army's gradual seizure of the Donbas accelerates
summary: Under increasingly heavy fire from Russian aircraft, the Ukrainian army has been forced to retreat in several urban areas. The military deplore the lack of anti-aircraft systems, as well as command errors.

title: How the Rassemblement National found itself on the doorstep of power
summary: Marine Le Pen has been riding a wave of positive momentum for the past two years, which could give her far-right party a majority in the Assemblée Nationale just two years after a difficult presidential election.

title: Reformist candidate Masoud Pezeshkian wins Iran's presidential runoff election
summary: A vote count offered by authorities put Pezeshkian as the winner with 16.3 million votes to Saeed Jalili’s 13.5 million in Friday’s election.

title: Israeli strikes kill 6 in Gaza, including kids and UN worker, as stalled truce talks reemerge
summary: Amid the latest deadly strikes, a team of Israeli negotiators is set to resume talks next week on a ceasefire and hostage exchange deal with Hamas, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s office said Friday, signaling progress toward a deal to end the war in Gaza after negotiations appeared stuck for weeks.

title: UK general election: Keir Starmer, the architect of Labour's triumphant comeback
summary: The next British prime minister, 61, has reshaped the Labour Party by marginalizing its left wing and rejecting costly budgetary promises.

title: Joe Biden maintains his candidacy but fails to reassure Democrats
summary: Speaking on ABC, the US president shut down calls to withdraw from the race, considering himself as the 'most qualified' to beat Donald Trump. Yet since his failed debate, Democratic voices are increasingly urging him to step aside.

title: The RN vote creeps into families: 'I was really ashamed, and he felt it'
summary: The far right's success has not only reshaped the French political landscape but also penetrated the intimacy of the home. Five families explain this swing, motivated by fear, disillusionment, exasperation and prejudice, which forces everyone to take a stand.

title: UK PM Keir Starmer's new government is characterized by social diversity
summary: Several important ministers hail from very modest families and were schooled in the public education system, breaking with prior Conservative governments, whose members were mostly educated in private schools.

title: Dmitri Tcherniakov: 'There's nothing exceptional about the Atreides family, they're people of today'
summary: In an interview, the Russian theatre director, who opened the Festival d'Aix-en-Provence on July 3, explains how he conceived his diptych of Gluck operas around Iphigenia.
